background_description: The background consists of a textured concrete or paved surface, scattered with numerous dry, fallen leaves in various shades of brown and reddish-brown. There are also patches of dark, moist soil or dirt and some green moss. The toad is resting on the heads of two straw brooms, which are made of yellowish-brown natural fibers and have wooden handles. The brooms are lying on the ground amidst the leaves and dirt.
camouflage_type: Color blending / Pattern matching / Shape disruption
explanation: The toad exhibits effective camouflage in this image. Its mottled skin, featuring shades of olive-brown and darker spots, closely matches the earthy tones of the surrounding environment, particularly the dried leaves and dark soil. While the broom's straw is a lighter yellowish-brown, the toad's darker markings and overall hue prevent it from starkly contrasting. The warty, irregular texture of its skin also blends reasonably well with the fibrous texture of the broom bristles and the rough, crinkled texture of the fallen leaves and dirt. Furthermore, the toad's squat, irregular shape helps to disrupt its outline against the varied textures and patterns of the brooms and ground debris, making it less distinguishable at first glance. The combination of color blending, pattern matching, and shape disruption significantly reduces its visibility.
